content.text: Some businesses depend heavily on raw material prices such as crude oil, metals, rubber, or agricultural inputs. When commodity prices rise, company costs increase and profit margins may shrink unless the company can raise product prices.
Commodity dependence makes profits volatile. Cement, steel, tyre, and airline companies in India are typical examples where commodity cycles strongly impact earnings.
Investors must understand whether the company can pass costs to customers or must absorb them internally.
